feedback.Physical object: Included — A tangible, discrete object occupying space.
feedback.Man-made / synthetic: Included — Designed and mass-produced by humans.
feedback.Biological or biologically-inspired: Excluded — No biological origin or mimicry.
feedback.Fixed/static: Included — Rigid in form and stable without external force.
feedback.Structural: Excluded — Not a load-bearing or framework element.
feedback.Perceptible: Included — Can be perceived by touch and sight.
feedback.Passive: Included — Does not act or change autonomously.
feedback.Purposeful / intentional: Included — Designed for a clear function: binding paper.
feedback.Emits output / produces effect: Excluded — No emission or effect beyond holding by force.
feedback.Transforms or modifies internal state: Excluded — Does not dynamically alter itself.
feedback.Interacts with humans directly: Included — Intended for direct manual use.
feedback.Part of a larger system: Excluded — Not inherently system-bound or dependent.
feedback.System-critical: Excluded — Not critical to any operational system.
feedback.Logical / rule-based: Excluded — Not based on logic operations.
feedback.Hierarchical / modular: Excluded — Not composed of modular subparts.
feedback.Temporal: Excluded — No intrinsic relation to time.
feedback.Contextual abstraction: Excluded — Identity remains stable across contexts.
feedback.Socially / culturally constructed: Included — Exists only due to human cultural systems.
feedback.Defined by a group/system: Included — Categorized and standardized within office/stationery domains.
feedback.Linked to identity or role: Excluded — Does not signal social role or identity.
feedback.Regulated / governed: Excluded — Not subject to meaningful regulation.
feedback.Teachable / transmissible: Excluded — Not taught as a concept; usage is intuitive.
feedback.Context-sensitive: Excluded — Maintains identity and function across settings.
